item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, September 1, 2024 at 7:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Building LLMs from the Ground Up: A 3-Hour Coding Workshop (489 points | 24 comments)
2. Playstation 2 GS emulation – the final frontier of Vulkan compute emulation (70 points | 10 comments)
3. Taming the beast that is the Django ORM – An introduction (75 points | 28 comments)
4. Harder Drive: hard drives we didn't want, or need [video] (2022) (322 points | 57 comments)
5. Did your car witness a crime? (203 points | 430 comments)
6. Making an atomic trampoline [video] (76 points | 17 comments)
7. MapRoulette: the micro-tasking tool for OpenStreetMap (46 points | 11 comments)
8. A brief history of barbed wire fence telephone networks (59 points | 7 comments)
9. WatchYourLAN: Lightweight Network IP Scanner (125 points | 11 comments)
10. The Atari 7800 (12 points | 4 comments)
11. Percona Everest: open-source automated database provisioning and management (58 points | 23 comments)
12. Astronomers puzzled by little red galaxies that seem impossibly dense (51 points | 31 comments)
13. Brazil's X ban is sending lots of people to Bluesky (202 points | 346 comments)
14. Client-side QR code generator with SVG output (88 points | 15 comments)
15. Epilepsy Protection for VRChat (15 points | 1 comment)
16. Non-Determinism and Overcount on Modern Hardware Performance Counters [pdf] (18 points | 1 comment)
17. Show HN: A retro terminal text editor for GNU/Linux coded in C (C-edit) (136 points | 37 comments)
18. Show HN: Typeform alternative, turns Markdown to forms (142 points | 59 comments)
19. The Null Pointer (3 points | discuss)
20. Neutral beam microscopy using magnetic beam spin encoding (25 points | discuss)
21. Lucee: A light-weight dynamic CFML scripting language for the JVM (68 points | 25 comments)
22. Chatbots Are Primed to Warp Reality (12 points | 8 comments)
23. The case of the nearly 7k missing pancreases (16 points | 1 comment)
24. Continue (YC S23) Is Hiring a Software Engineer in San Francisco ( | hide)
25. Solving the labyrinth puzzle from the university quest using Python (8 points | discuss)
26. Buy, Borrow, Die – Explained (409 points | 323 comments)
27. Is my vision that bad? No, it's just a bug in Apple's Calculator (575 points | 363 comments)
28. AI is growing faster than companies can secure it, warn industry leaders (9 points | 3 comments)
29. There is only one amphibian emoji (53 points | 62 comments)
30. My fake job in Y2K preparedness (117 points | 81 comments)
